meanings.definition: Scrine (verb): to write or draw hastily or carelessly
meanings.sent1: I had to scrine down my notes quickly before the class started.
meanings.sent2: She always scrines her signature on documents without paying attention.
meanings.sent3: The student tried to scrine his essay in the last minute, but it ended up messy.
meanings.sent4: His handwriting was so rushed, it looked like he tried to scrine a secret code.
meanings.sent5: The artist would scrine his ideas on napkins whenever inspiration struck.

meanings.definition: Scrine (noun): a small, cramped or dirty writing desk
meanings.sent1: The antique shop had a beautiful scrine in the corner.
meanings.sent2: She kept her pens and papers in the old scrine by the window.
meanings.sent3: The scrine in the library was so cluttered, it was hard to find anything.
meanings.sent4: The scrine in the attic was like a forgotten treasure chest of memories.
meanings.sent5: The tiny scrine in the study was where he wrote his best stories.

meanings.definition: Scrine (adjective): describing something that is messy or disorganized
meanings.sent1: Her room was always scrine with clothes strewn everywhere.
meanings.sent2: The scrine desk in the office made it hard to find important papers.
meanings.sent3: The scrine kitchen was a chaotic mess of pots and pans.
meanings.sent4: The scrine closet was a jumble of shoes and old boxes.
meanings.sent5: The backyard was scrine with toys and tools scattered around.
